00014 #ifndef driverH
00015 #define driverH
00016 
00017 #include "xnode.h"
00018 #include "xlistnode.h"
00019 #include <vector>
00020 #include <set>
00021 
00022 class XRecordDependency;
00023 class XScalarEntryList;
00024 class XInterfaceList;
00025 class XThermometerList;
00026 class XDriverList;
00027 
00028 //! Base class for all instrument drivers
00029 class XDriver : public XNode
00030 {
00031     XNODE_OBJECT
00032 protected:
00033     XDriver(const char *name, bool runtime,
00034             const shared_ptr<XScalarEntryList> &scalarentries,
00035             const shared_ptr<XInterfaceList> &interfaces,
00036             const shared_ptr<XThermometerList> &thermometers,
00037             const shared_ptr<XDriverList> &drivers);
00038 public:
00039     virtual ~XDriver() {}
00040 
00041     //! show all forms belonging to driver
00042     virtual void showForms() = 0;
00043  
00044     //! called during parsing
00045     XTalker<shared_ptr<XDriver> > &onRecord() {return m_tlkRecord;}
00046     //! lock analysed members and entries
00047     void readLockRecord() const;
00048     void readUnlockRecord() const;
00049   
00050     //! recorded time.
00051     //! time when phenomenon finished and recorded.
00052     //! analyses must be based on this time.
00053     //! zero if record is invalid.
00054     const XTime &time() const {return m_recordTime;}
00055     //! time when an operator (you) can see a phenomenon. 
00056     //! manual operations (ex. pushing clear button) must be based on this time.
00057     //! time when a phenomenon starts if measuement is on real-time.
00058     //! time when record is read if measuement is *not* on real-time.
00059     //! unknown if record is invalid.
00060     const XTime &timeAwared() const {return m_awaredTime;}
00061   
00062     virtual const shared_ptr<XRecordDependency> dependency() const = 0;
00063 protected:
00064     //! throwing this exception will cause reset of record time
00065     //! And, print error message
00066     struct XRecordError : public XKameError {
00067         XRecordError(const XString &s, const char *file, int line) : XKameError(s, file, line) {}
00068     };
00069     //! throwing this exception will skip signal emission, assuming record is kept valid.
00070     struct XSkippedRecordError : public XRecordError {
00071         XSkippedRecordError(const XString &s, const char *file, int line) : XRecordError(s, file, line) {}
00072         XSkippedRecordError(const char *file, int line) : XRecordError("", file, line) {}
00073     };
00074     //! size of raw record is not enough to continue analyzing 
00075     struct XBufferUnderflowRecordError : public XRecordError {
00076         XBufferUnderflowRecordError(const char *file, int line);
00077     };
00078  
00079     //! this is called after analyze() or analyzeRaw()
00080     //! record is readLocked
00081     //! This might be called even if the record is broken (time() == false).
00082     virtual void visualize() = 0;
00083   
00084     //! writeLock record and readLock all dependent drivers
00085     //! \return true if locked.
00086     bool tryStartRecording();
00087     //! m_tlkRecord is invoked after unlocking
00088     //! \sa time(), timeAwared()
00089     void finishRecordingNReadLock(const XTime &time_awared, const XTime &time_recorded);
00090     //! leave existing record.
00091     void abortRecording();
00092     //! leave existing record.
00093     void abortRecordingNReadLock();
00094     //! Lock this record and dependent drivers
00095 private:
00096     XTalker<shared_ptr<XDriver> > m_tlkRecord;
00097     //! mutex for record
00098     XRecursiveRWLock m_recordLock;
00099     //! \sa time()
00100     XTime m_recordTime;
00101     //! \sa timeAwared()
00102     XTime m_awaredTime;
00103 };
00104 
00105 //! When a record depends on other records, multiple delegations may cause a confilct of time stamps. This class can detect it.
00106 class XRecordDependency
00107 {
00108 public:
00109     XRecordDependency();
00110     XRecordDependency(const shared_ptr<XRecordDependency> &);
00111     //! \return true if conflicted.
00112     //! Search for entry which has the same driver and different times.
00113     bool merge(const shared_ptr<const XDriver> &driver);
00114     void clear();
00115     
00116     bool isConflict() const {return m_bConflict;}
00117 private:
00118     bool m_bConflict;
00119     struct tDependency {
00120         tDependency(const shared_ptr<const XDriver> &d, const XTime &time);
00121         bool operator<(const tDependency &d) const;
00122         shared_ptr<const XDriver> driver;    
00123         XTime time;
00124     };
00125     //! written on recording
00126     std::set<tDependency> m_dependency;
00127     typedef std::set<tDependency>::iterator tDependency_it;
00128 
00129 };

00132 class XDriverList : public XCustomTypeListNode<XDriver>
00133 {
00134     XNODE_OBJECT
00135 protected:
00136     XDriverList(const char *name, bool runtime,
00137                 const shared_ptr<XScalarEntryList> &scalarentries,
00138                 const shared_ptr<XInterfaceList> &interfaces,
00139                 const shared_ptr<XThermometerList> &thermometers);
00140 public:
00141     DEFINE_TYPE_HOLDER_EXTRA_PARAMS_4(
00142         const shared_ptr<XScalarEntryList> &,
00143         const shared_ptr<XInterfaceList> &,
00144         const shared_ptr<XThermometerList> &,
00145         const shared_ptr<XDriverList> &
00146         )
00147         virtual shared_ptr<XNode> createByTypename(const XString &type, const XString& name);
00148 private:
00149     const shared_ptr<XScalarEntryList> m_scalarentries;
00150     const shared_ptr<XInterfaceList> m_interfaces;
00151     const shared_ptr<XThermometerList> m_thermometers;
00152 };
00153 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00154 #endif
